label: Separate launch + check
info:
# Separate launch + check Workflow

This example shows the separate 'Launch' and 'Check' nodes, which offer maximum customisability. There is a timer node to keep checking the status whilst the workflow is running.

1. Configure the Seqera Platform connection with your API token
2. Set the launchpad name and parameters
3. Launch the workflow and monitor its execution

name: Triggering a launch
info:
This is an example node that you can simply
click on to trigger a workflow launch.

You can replace this with an automated trigger
of your choice: a file being uploaded to AWS,
a Slack message, a time of day, a particular
weather forecast - whatever you can think of!

name: Launch
info:
This node launches a workflow on Seqera Platform.
Once launched, the node returns the response
from Platform. It does not monitor the run status.

For convenience, it can take the name of a pipeline
in your Seqera Platform Launchpad.
It fetches the pipeline details and uses this for launch.
If you prefer, you can also provide all of the workflow
details to the node directly instead of fetching from
the launchpad.

name: Check
info:
This node checks a workflow status on Seqera Platform.
It returns the response and exits.
There are two outputs - one is used if the workflow
status indicates that the run is ongoing.
The second is used if the status indicates that it has
finished.

## Repeated checks

For the purposes of the demonstration, a delay
node has been attached to the status output which then
feeds back into the check node.
This means that the node will keep firing to check status
every 5 seconds.

If this is what you're after, check the other nodes -
there is one that launches and monitors which includes
a regular check within the node, so no loop is needed.
